TopicTitle: Allow more than one airlock per command pod / crew cabin

Articles.Content:
Feature Request Entry on KSP Bugtracker

I've noticed that at present, command pods and crewed cabins appears to be currently limited to one airlock each.

I would like to propose allowing any number of additional airlock locations to be specified per-pod in the part modelling / Unity configuration process - this would be useful for add-on authors such as myself who wish to make large crew cabins / habitats for space stations with multiple entry/exit locations.

To support this suggestion, the behaviour of the EVA button corresponding to each crew portrait might also need a bit of a tweak:

- Upon clicking on the EVA button, the game determines which pod / cabin the Kerbal is currently in, as well as how many airlocks are available within that pod/cabin

- Usually, the Kerbal should exit out of the first-defined airlock hatch

- If the first-defined or any other hatches are obstructed, the game should attempt to have the Kerbal exit out of the next available airlock

- If all hatches are obstructed, only then would the "Hatch Obstructed, Cannot Exit" exception be thrown.

EDIT: As Captain Sierra pointed out, airlocks can also be directly clicked on to initiate EVA; however, the latter half of my post describes exception handling if the user clicks on the portrait EVA button instead.

Edited October 1, 2013 by sumghai

As a user and supporter of your station parts, seconded.
